fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

With 8.7, the default behavior of the *Enable HTML in custom field descriptions* and list values items option will now be switched to OFF for new Jira installations and the upgraded ones that have never used it. Please check the link below for details :
 * 
 ** [Upgrade notes|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftware/jira-software-8-7-x-upgrade-notes-]

With this option set to off by default, many systems field descriptions that contains HTML characters are represented with HTML code there than plain text 

  !Screenshot 2020-04-15 at 7.34.26 PM.png|thumbnail! 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to field configuration tab>time tracking
 # You will see under description the HTML code appears

h3. Expected Results

If "Enable HTML in custom field descriptions" is set to off by default then the system field description should be adjusted to display as plain text rather then HTML code
h3. Actual Results

Right now when we check the system field description then it is showing the HTML code in the description
h3. Workaround

User can turn on the "Enable HTML in custom field descriptions" option which resolves the issue
fields.summary: Disabling HTML renderer in custom field description breaks the system field description

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Manually deleting Jira HTTP Access Logs cause them to not be recreated before an application restart.
(!) Note that enabling Jira HTTP Access Logs is not recommended and Tomcat access logs preferably should be used since they are enabled by default.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Enable HTTP Access Logs;
# Manually delete the HTTP Access Logs files;
# Disable HTTP Access Logs;
# Re-enable HTTP Access Logs;

h3. Expected Results
A new log file is created/rotated

h3. Actual Results
The file is not created 

h3. Workaround
Restart Jira and re-enable HTTP Access Logs
fields.summary: Manually deleting HTTP Access Logs cause them to not be recreated before an application restart.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

After changing/updating the "CDN URL" property (Admin → System → Content Delivery Network) with a new URL, I noticed that some resources were still being requested by my browser which referenced the prior CDN URL, even with the browser's cache disabled or when using incognito windows. On further investigation, I found that these assets were being requested as downstream components by CSS and JS via URLs referencing the old CDN, even when loaded directly from Jira (bypassing new CDN). E.g.: when _batch.css_ is loaded from new CDN or directly from Jira, it contains references to static asset _adgs-icons.woff_ on old CDN.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Configure Jira with a CDN URL for the Content Delivery Network feature
 # Browse some pages (issues, dashboards, etc) on Jira to ensure static assets which reference the CDN are created and cached by Jira
 # Configure Jira with a new, different CDN URL

h3. Expected Results

No requests should be made to load assets from the previously-configured CDN URL.
h3. Actual Results

Browse some pages (issues, dashboards, etc) and view network traffic via the web inspector tool; see that some resources are still requested from previously-configured CDN.

This can also be seen by directly viewing the files located at {{$JIRA_HOME/tmp/webresources}} which will contain said references to files on the old CDN.
h3. Workaround
 # Change CDN URL to new/desired value
 # *Immediately* delete the files located at {{$JIRA_HOME/tmp/webresources/*}}
 # If any pages were loaded between steps 1 and 2, you'll _also_ need to invalidate those assets on the newly-configured CDN itself, as they will already have been retrieved and cached there as well.
fields.summary: Changing the configured CDN URL does not work

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Opening a JQL query that was created in "Detail View", into an instance that is in the "List view", opens just the first issue o the query results, instead of the query results.

This is issue is not happening from "List View" to "Detail View".
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to Issue search.
 # Change the view to *"Detail View"*
 # Create an advanced/basic JQL query (for example): *order by lastViewed DESC*
 # Search the query.
 # Copy and save the search link (for example): [http://localhost:8080/browse/TDC-7?jql=order%20by%20lastViewed%20DESC]
 (i) Note that the *TDC-7* in the query is the first result of the JQL query.
 # Change the view to *"List View"*.
 # Paste the saved link in the URL and search.
 # The first issue *(TDC-7)* view will open, instead of the "*Detail View*".

h3. Expected Results

Open the *"Detail View"* instead of the First issue view.
h3. Actual Results

The first issue of the JQL query returns, instead of the "*Detail View*". This issue is not happening if have more than 
h3. Workaround

Click on the *"Return to search"* link (or type *'u'*) and switch back to *"Detail View"*.
fields.summary: Opening a JQL search link that is from "Detail view", in a "List view" instance, open the first Issue of the search

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Some field values automatically clear when leaving a required field empty when creating issues from Admin mode, but when using the Create Issue pop-up window the behaviour does not occur. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Creating a new issue out of Admin mode pops up a Create Issue window, where unfilled required fields will be notified:
#* !createpopup.png|thumbnail!
# Creating a new issue from Admin mode (e.g. from Administration -> Issues) will not pop up a Create Issue window, instead, the process will go through 2 phases:
#* !createadmin.png|thumbnail!
#* !createerror.png|thumbnail!

# Step 1: Click "Create Issue" so that you are navigated to a separate browser tab (not pop-up).
# Step 2: Fill the section with "Linked Issues". At the same time, leave any required field as empty.
# Step 3: Click "create".
# Step 4: Jira shows that some required field must be filled.


h3. Expected Results

The point is, other field values will be remained if already filled, including Epic Link, Sprint, and Linked Issues:
!createremain.png|thumbnail!

h3. Actual Results
JIRA clears field with linked issues. The point is, if required fields are unfilled (and the page refreshes), then specific fields will lose their filled value or even go missing. In the following screenshot, Epic Link, Sprint, and Linked Issues are losing their filled value (automatically cleared) while Remaining Estimate is missing:
!createcleared.png|thumbnail!

h3. Note

This problem is not reproduced while trying to create an issue from pop-up – in this case, JIRA saves all filled linked issues as expected.

h3. Workaround
* Make sure required fields are filled before clicking on Create to create a new issue
* Use the Create Issue pop-up window out of Admin mode
fields.summary: Field values automatically cleared due to unfilled required fields when creating issues from Admin mode

fields.description:
I found the following command in Dockerfile of official docker image (docker history).

{{chown -R root. ${JIRA_INSTALL_DIR}/}}

The dot after owner confuses me, I'm surprised that chown accept such input.

[GNU coreutils manual|https://www.gnu.org/software/coreutils/manual/html_node/chown-invocation.html]:
{quote}Some older scripts may still use ‘{{.}}’ in place of the ‘{{:}}’ separator. POSIX 1003.1-2001 (see Standards conformance) does not require support for that, but for backward compatibility GNU {{chown}} supports ‘{{.}}’ so long as no ambiguity results. New scripts should avoid the use of ‘{{.}}’ because it is not portable, and because it has undesirable results if the entire owner‘{{.}}’group happens to identify a user whose name contains ‘{{.}}’.
{quote}
Please replace dot with colon, for sanity.
fields.summary: Confusing command in Dockerfile of official docker image

fields.description: As a Jira admin, I would like to have the ability to look for exact matches in the summary field using the equals operator (*=*). Currently, the (*~*) operator, will provide partial matches, but that is not enough for certain operations, especially when combining Jira with the additional functionalities offered by Automation for Jira.
fields.summary: Allow the usage of the EQUALS operator (=) with the Summary field.

fields.description:
The current "create shared objects" global permission controls the "ability to share dashboards and filters with other users, groups, and roles". Those who do not have this permission will still be able to create and save dashboards and filters, they just won't be able to share them.

It's perfectly reasonable to expect that a software such a Jira would be able to provide a true read-only user experience, but this is not currently the case. There is no setting currently in Jira, global or project-level, that can restrict a user from creating objects (or exporting data, for that matter). This seems like an important oversight and something that has a very broad use case, including allowing for temporary visitors from other projects, or even auditors who must have view-only access to a live project but also must abide by very specific restrictions.
fields.summary: Split the "create shared objects" global permission into "create objects" and "share objects"

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

When a Scrum or Kanban Board is using a [Simplified Workflow|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwareserver/using-the-simplified-workflow-938845286.html], there is a feature available where the administrator may configure specific statuses to automatically set a Resolution value upon an issue entering that status. The effect of this configuration is that the underlying Simplified Workflow will have a Post-function added to each transition that sets that Resolution automatically.

When a board is not configured with a Simplified Workflow, this feature is not available.

It would be convenient to board administrators of this feature could still be implemented with non-Simplified Workflows. Enabling the feature on a status could insert the post-function into every step that transitions into that status, as well as all future transitions introduced.

h3. Suggested Solution
 
Implement the same functionality to be available for non-Simplified Workflows.

h3. Workaround 

Manually manage all workflow transitions to add the Post-function where needed.
fields.summary: Allow board administrators to set resolution on statuses even when not using simplified workflows

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

There is an issue with Jira mobile interface in Jira - when SAML SSO is used, the mobile interface reports itself as "not logged in" in a sidebar, however, this is a mistake and the user is in fact logged in. The issue makes it impossible to logout from Jira using a mobile interface, or get to the user settings screen.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Switch to a mobile Jira interface, and login into SSO-enabled Jira
 # Open the sidebar and observe yourself not being logged in

h3. Expected Results

Mobile interface reflects user login status correctly.

h3. Actual Results

User is reported as not logged in.

h3. Workaround

The following workaround is currently available until this issue is fixed:
- Rename their username not to contain the @ symbol. I.e. user@example.com -> admin

To logout, users can ignore incorrect menu item and manually navigate to the logout page: /jira/secure/Logout!default.jspa
fields.summary: Mobile interface does not display user as logged when SAML SSO is used

As a suggestion, why can't we have drop down with sorting options like default option(current sorting with released & non-released versions,  Ascending and Descending order so that end user can use appropriate option which suites for them
fields.summary: Fix version(s) doesn't have sorting - need an improvement

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The Atlassian Analytics plugin prevents Tomcat from cleanly shutting down, as it leaves "Analytics" non-daemon threads that are not able to be stopped by the shutdown process. 

This results in the message in the log always, regardless of the shutdown timeout:
{code:java}
Tomcat did not stop in time.
To aid diagnostics a thread dump has been written to standard out.
Killing Tomcat with the PID: 12726
The Tomcat process has been killed. {code}
*Impact*
 If Tomcat is able to shutdown all threads except for the Analytics threads, there is no impact.

The concern is that this problem will mask an administrators ability to set the shutdown value correctly since Jira will never cleanly shutdown. If Jira terminated while shutting down but is actually doing some useful operation, there may be a risk that operation is terminated half way through. Therefore, we should always aim for a graceful shutdown. Also, it will delay the shutdown time as the script will always wait for the timeout value to be reached before existing.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # On Jira 8.5.3, *Jira Admin -> System -> Analytics -> Enable*
 # Edit {{JIRAINST/bin/stop-jira.sh}} and modify the shutdown timeout on following two lines to 300. This allows enough time for Tomcat to attempt a clean shutdown
{code:java}
exec $PRGDIR/shutdown.sh 300 -force $@
$sucmd -m $JIRA_USER -c "$PRGDIR/shutdown.sh 300 -force $@"{code}

 # On the console, execute {{JIRAINST/bin/stop-jira.sh}}
 # The script will wait 300 seconds, then eventually terminate due to stuck Analytics threads:
{code:java}
The Tomcat process has been killed.  {code}

h3. Expected Results

Jira shuts down cleanly without having to be killed:
{code:java}
Tomcat stopped.{code}
h3. Actual Results

The script will wait indefinitely for Tomcat to shutdown until the timeout value in stop-jira.sh has been reached. The script will then forcefully kill tomcat
{code:java}
Tomcat did not stop in time.
To aid diagnostics a thread dump has been written to standard out.
Killing Tomcat with the PID: 12726
The Tomcat process has been killed.{code}
 

{{org.apache.catalina.loader.WebappClassLoaderBase.clearReferencesThreads()}} will alert that Analytics threads to not stop, and a thread dump will be written to catalina.out showing the non-daemon Analytics threads:
{code:java}
07-Apr-2020 11:28:14.660 WARNING [localhost-startStop-2] org.apache.catalina.loader.WebappClassLoaderBase.clearReferencesThreads The web application [j853] appears to have started a thread named [Analytics] but has failed to stop it. This is very likely to create a memory leak. Stack trace of thread:
 sun.misc.Unsafe.park(Native Method)
 java.util.concurrent.locks.LockSupport.park(LockSupport.java:175)
 java.util.concurrent.locks.AbstractQueuedSynchronizer$ConditionObject.await(AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.java:2039)
 java.util.concurrent.LinkedBlockingQueue.take(LinkedBlockingQueue.java:442)
 java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.getTask(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1074)
 java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1134)
 java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:624)
 com.segment.analytics.Platform$1$1.run(Platform.java:45)
 java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:748)

07-Apr-2020 11:28:14.677 INFO [main] org.apache.coyote.AbstractProtocol.stop Stopping ProtocolHandler ["http-nio-8853"]
07-Apr-2020 11:28:14.681 INFO [main] org.apache.coyote.AbstractProtocol.destroy Destroying ProtocolHandler ["http-nio-8853"]
2020-04-07 11:29:33
Full thread dump OpenJDK 64-Bit Server VM (25.202-b08 mixed mode):

"DestroyJavaVM" #345 prio=5 os_prio=31 tid=0x00007fd14d4ee000 nid=0x2303 waiting on condition [0x0000000000000000]
   java.lang.Thread.State: RUNNABLE

"Java2D Disposer" #309 daemon prio=10 os_prio=31 tid=0x00007fd146abb800 nid=0xb307 in Object.wait() [0x0000700011806000]
   java.lang.Thread.State: WAITING (on object monitor)
	at java.lang.Object.wait(Native Method)
	at java.lang.ref.ReferenceQueue.remove(ReferenceQueue.java:144)
	- locked <0x0000000758fe8e08> (a java.lang.ref.ReferenceQueue$Lock)
	at java.lang.ref.ReferenceQueue.remove(ReferenceQueue.java:165)
	at sun.java2d.Disposer.run(Disposer.java:148)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:748)

"Analytics" #215 prio=1 os_prio=31 tid=0x00007fd14bad5000 nid=0x1570f waiting on condition [0x0000700013151000]
   java.lang.Thread.State: WAITING (parking)
	at sun.misc.Unsafe.park(Native Method)
	- parking to wait for  <0x00000007564977e8> (a java.util.concurrent.locks.AbstractQueuedSynchronizer$ConditionObject)
	at java.util.concurrent.locks.LockSupport.park(LockSupport.java:175)
	at java.util.concurrent.locks.AbstractQueuedSynchronizer$ConditionObject.await(AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.java:2039)
	at java.util.concurrent.LinkedBlockingQueue.take(LinkedBlockingQueue.java:442)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.getTask(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1074)

"Analytics" #213 prio=1 os_prio=31 tid=0x00007fd1474e9000 nid=0x1ed03 waiting on condition [0x0000700014181000]
   java.lang.Thread.State: TIMED_WAITING (parking)
	at sun.misc.Unsafe.park(Native Method)
	- parking to wait for  <0x00000007564d6fc8> (a java.util.concurrent.locks.AbstractQueuedSynchronizer$ConditionObject)
	at java.util.concurrent.locks.LockSupport.parkNanos(LockSupport.java:215)
	at java.util.concurrent.locks.AbstractQueuedSynchronizer$ConditionObject.awaitNanos(AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.java:2078)
	at java.util.concurrent.ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor$DelayedWorkQueue.take(ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor.java:1093)

 {code}
 
h3. Workaround
 # Disable Analytics in Jira Admin -> System -> Analytics -> Disable
 # Modify the timeouts in stop-jira.sh to a reasonable value that gives Tomcat enough time to stop cleanly. This will vary depending on the environment and plugins installed {code:java}
exec $PRGDIR/shutdown.sh 120 -force $@ 
$sucmd -m $JIRA_USER -c "$PRGDIR/shutdown.sh 120 -force $@" {code}
 # Stop and start Jira to apply the change
 # Stop Jira via ./stop-jira.sh and measure success

(i) Note that Analytics threads will hang around until the Jira service is restarted. So, to validate the change, please reboot at least once before checking for success
fields.summary: Enabling analytics prevents Jira from shutting down cleanly

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When deleting an issue, the issue it's data should be removed.  But labels do not get removed, leaving an orphaned entry in the labels table.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an issue and add a label.  In this example I'll add "testlabel"
# Delete this newly created issue

h3. Expected Results
The issue is deleted, as well as the "testlabel" association.

h3. Actual Results
The issue is deleted, but an entry remains in the database:
{code}
jira851test=# select * from label where issue not in (select id from jiraissue );
  id   | fieldid | issue |   label
-------+---------+-------+-----------
 10201 |         | 10300 | testlabel
(1 row)
{code}
* issue 10300 does not exist as it was deleted, but we still see this entry associating the "testlabel" to this non-existent issue.

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Deleting an Issue Does not Remove Associated Labels

fields.description:
It would be awesome if saved filters could have version control. There are many times users are updating a filter and then realize that the new JQL didn't do what was expected

In these cases the original JQL is gone.

A simple version handling would solve this. Either the entire history or at least the last version, just to be able to recover from a faulty change
fields.summary: Saved filter should have version control

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When users search for issues, they can accidentally assign the issue to themselves using keyboard shortcuts. 

However, this behavior results in issues being assigned unexpectedly. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Look at a list of issues
 # Press the 'I' keyboard shortcut
 # The issue will be assigned to you

h3. Expected Results

Disable keyboard shortcuts unless you are accessing an issue directly. 
h3. Workaround

Disable the hotkeys with the following steps:
 * Ensure you are logged in and open the [Keyboard Shortcuts dialog box|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracoreserver074/using-keyboard-shortcuts-921047262.html] 
 * At the bottom of the Keyboard Shortcuts dialog box, click Disable Keyboard Shortcuts

(?) You can also disable or re-enable keyboard shortcuts by editing the Preferences section of your user profile. See Managing your user profile for more information.
fields.summary: Disable Keyboard Shortcuts on search results

fields.description:
When working with issues in Jira you need to add a linked issue before being able to add a linked Confluence or Web Link.

This can be simplified by adding it as a default option to add a Confluence article or Web Link.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Jira does a good job formatting plain text tables when they're added as comments. For example, a SQL result set will look nicely formatted the same way it look in the console. 

However, when exact same plain text in the comment is added via an email handler, it looks misformatted. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add a SQL output as a comment to a Jira issue between noformat tags. For example: 
{noformat}
jiradb_7134=# SELECT remote_address,created,author_key,summary, object_type FROM audit_log LIMIT 3;
 remote_address  |          created           | author_key |         summary         | object_type
-----------------+----------------------------+------------+-------------------------+-------------
 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 | 2019-09-05 10:53:24.974+01 |            | Group created           | GROUP
 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 | 2019-09-05 10:53:25.043+01 |            | Global permission added | PERMISSIONS
 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 | 2019-09-05 10:53:25.051+01 |            | Global permission added | PERMISSIONS
(3 rows)
{noformat}
# Verify the table is displayed nicely: 
!comment_ui.png|thumbnail! 
# Post the same comment via an email handler. 
First configure the mail file handler that allows to create comments,
than create a <jirahome>/import/mail/mail.eml file with the following content:

{code}
To: jira@example.com
From: some-jira-user@example.com
Subject: TEST-14 issue summary title here

Body of the email goes here
{noformat}
jiradb_7134=# SELECT remote_address,created,author_key,summary,
object_type FROM audit_log LIMIT 3;
remote_address  |          created           | author_key |
summary         | object_type
-----------------+----------------------------+------------+-------------------------+-------------
0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 | 2019-09-05 10:53:24.974+01 |            | Group
created           | GROUP
0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 | 2019-09-05 10:53:25.043+01 |            | Global
permission added | PERMISSIONS
0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 | 2019-09-05 10:53:25.051+01 |            | Global
permission added | PERMISSIONS
(3 rows)
{noformat}
{code}
And wait a moment until the comment appears.
Please mind that the subject must start with an issue key of an existing issue for the comment to be added (TEST-14 in this example).

h3. Expected Results
The comment should show as if it was added through the UI.

h3. Actual Results
The plain text table doesn't display nicely. Instead, rows are split across two lines and there are extra spaces added that make the output misformatted: 
 !comment_email.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
None
fields.summary: Tables in plain text are not formatted properly if comment is added by a mail handler

fields.description:
h3. Scenario:
- User tries to publish a workflow, however scenario fails. 
- Observed below mentioned message before failure of this event:
_localq-stats-0 INFO [c.a.j.c.distribution.localq.LocalQCacheManager] [scheduled] Running cache replication queue stats for: 10 queues..._
- Updated jira.cache.replication.localq.queue.stats.logging.interval.seconds value to increase the time interval between cache replications
- This resolved the issue. 

h3. Suggestion: 
Can we have the cache synchronisation between the nodes not to affect the publishing of workflows?
fields.summary: Cache replication failure results into issue with publishing the workflow

fields.description: In Jira under the releases tab you see a list of releases for different components which becomes quite long and difficult to handle after a while. It would be much easier to handle if it would be possible to sort the list via selecting the column to sort the list by. This would be useful for both components and releases. We have more than 10 components and therefore a multiple number of releases in our project, so it is difficult to find the right releases to set to another status and keep the list tidy. If we do not tidy up here we have struggle when selecting the affected or fixed version - or is there any other solution to that wich we dont see?
fields.summary: Make it possible to sort the releases list via selecting the column

fields.description:
Hello Product Team,

Currently, there is an option to validate a CSV file before the actual import starts when using "Import from CSV"  functionality which comes under Issues Tab (as part of JIM plugin)


But we do not have such feature available when using  "External System Import" option (by going to settings ---> Back up and Restore -->  External System Import)

By not having this, the failure of there imports are known only after the import starts and we have to wait for it to finish. But with the validate option provided with Import from CSV functionality, we could validate the CSV for any potential failures even before the import begins. 

Can we have the validate option for Admins who use the "External System Import" option as well?
fields.summary: Can we have a CSV validator in place when using  External System Import
oh seongkooi

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
There are many places where Jira users/project admins/admins can see the list of issues types used in their projects. 

The order of issue types in this list is not consistent everywhere in Jira. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Drag and drop issue types in an issue type scheme and save. 
# Go to the summary page of a project (<BASE_URL>/plugins/servlet/project-config/<project_key>/summary) using the issue type scheme just updated and note the order of issue types. 
# Go to the issue type list of the project (when you click on *Issue types* in the project settings page or go to <BASE_URL>/plugins/servlet/project-config/<project_key>/issuetypes) and note the order of issue types. 

h3. Expected Results
Order of issue types should be consistent in all screens in Jira so project admins can see how they're ordered without having to see the issue type scheme itself. 

h3. Actual Results
* Issue types in the issue type scheme are ordered manually by admins. This is the source of truth. 
* The same order set by the admins in the issue type scheme is visible in the issue type dropdown on tickets. This is the order that should matter to the users. 
* In the project summary screen, issue types are ordered alphabetically. 
* In the project's issue types screen, issue types are ordered based on an unknown logic. Though, subtask issue types will always show last.

h3. Workaround
Project admins may look at the issue type dropdown to see what the order looks like. 
(!) However, the latest issue type used will be always be shown first, no matter what position it's in the issue type scheme.
fields.summary: Issue types are sorted/ordered inconsistently in different places in Jira

fields.description:
Some users prefer to keep the external links (websites) to be opened in a new tab however to keep the internal links or anchors within the same issue to open on the same window.

To clarify and reproduce:

1. Edit your user profile and set "External links: Open in new tab".

2. Create an issue with the following description.

Link: [#xx]
Should point here: {anchor:xx}

3. Open the new issue.

4. Click the "xx" link.

Expected behaviour:

The link should open in the current tab, because it is an internal link, not an external link.

Actual behaviour:

The link opens in a new tab. Also, it does not seem to scroll to the correct anchor, but that may depend on the Web browser.

Workaround:

Set "External links: Open in current tab" in your user profile.

Notes:

Adding JRASERVER-9380 Jira feature provided the option to chose the links' behavior however some users would like to control the specific links type (internal or external).
fields.summary: Internal links (anchors) behavior control to open in the same window

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The search (basic and advanced) in Jira today is limited in regards to when to return issues.  If the terms are found at all in the records being searched, the issue is always returned.  This does not allow for more restrictive search queries, such as specific word orders.   


h3. Suggested Solution
If Jira supported [regular expressions (regex)|https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Regular_expression] in JQL queries it would easily be possible to do this.  


h3. Why this is important
This would provide a much more comprehensive means to search for issues in Jira. regex is already a popular means to search for records in many libraries.
Having this option would also be beneficial to various other kinds of requested searching of Jira issues, which in turn would make things like filter results, and the subsequent dashboards gadgets based on those filters much more powerful, flexible, and potentially concise in the information they can return to users.

h3. Workaround 
The use of regular expressions (aka regex) is not currently possible to use in native Jira.  However there are 3rd party add-ons in Marketplace that make this possible today.  For example Scriptrunner has a number of these functions that accept regex queries in order to return issues in Jira. One example of this is [issueFieldMatch|https://scriptrunner.adaptavist.com/latest/jira/jql-functions.html#_issuefieldmatch]
fields.summary: Jira should permit the use of regex when searching for issues

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

On the [upgrade documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracore/upgrading-jira-data-center-976167016.html] mentions that is possible to disable plugins prior to the upgrade, and after the upgrade is finished, upgrade to compatible plugin version.
 This does not seem to work always.
 There are some disabled plugins that fail to load during the upgrade, causing the upgrade to fail, some examples are "Adaptavist ScriptRunner for JIRA" "Insight", etc.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Disable plugins trough Manage Apps
 # Proceed with upgrade
 # Jira will fail to start with an error like this one:
{code:java}
'com.onresolve.jira.groovy.groovyrunner' - 'Adaptavist ScriptRunner for JIRA'  failed to load.
            Cannot start plugin: com.onresolve.jira.groovy.groovyrunner
                Unable to resolve com.onresolve.jira.groovy.groovyrunner [214](R 214.0): missing requirement [com.onresolve.jira.groovy.groovyrunner [214](R 214.0)] osgi.wiring.package; (&(osgi.wiring.package=com.atlassian.crowd.embedded.api)(version>=7.2.9)) Unresolved requirements: [[com.onresolve.jira.groovy.groovyrunner [214](R 214.0)] osgi.wiring.package; (&(osgi.wiring.package=com.atlassian.crowd.embedded.api)(version>=7.2.9))]
            It was loaded from /var/jira-home/shared/plugins/installed-plugins/plugin_6370240216098382762_groovyrunner-5.4.45.jar{code}

And the plugin is currently disabled:
||Name||Status||Version||Vendor||
|Adaptavist ScriptRunner for JIRA|disabled|5.4.45|Adaptavist.com Ltd|
h3. Expected Results

Upgrade to finish with success.
h3. Actual Results

Upgrade fails because plugins are failing to start.
h3. Workaround

# Back up and then delete the contents of the /plugin folder in Jira. This will delete all the plugins you have. 
#*  a. on Server, go to <local-home-directory>/plugins. 
#* b. on DC, go to <shared-home-directory>/plugins. 
# After you've upgraded, install the compatible versions of your plugins.
fields.summary: Disabling a plugin during the upgrade might not be enough for the upgrade to complete

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When enabling autowatch for all tickets from the user preferences, the feature is not honored when creating a ticket. It shows 0 watchers and does not show the created when viewing all watchers. This was tested in Jira 8.0.0 and it functioned as expected. Customer found the issue in 8.4.1 and it was reproduced in a test instance of 8.4.2 and was not functioning as expected

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to your user profile page
 # Update the autowatch preference to enable for all tickets
 # Create a new ticket

h3. Expected Results

The user is added as a watcher

h3. Actual Results

No watcher is added

The below exception is thrown in the xxxxxxx.log file:

no logged messages

h3. Workaround

Plugin functionality may automate this process thus working around the behavior, but there is no confirmed plugin or script to workaround. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Enabling autowatch to your profile no longer functions

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Project dropdown menu in basic issue search does not respond on Internet Explorer / Edge browsers.

This is reproducible only on instance with larger number of projects (1000 in reproduction scenario).

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Make sure to have many projects on the instance.
#* On a test instance, [Jira Data Generator|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1210725/data-generator-for-jira?hosting=server&tab=overview|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1210725/data-generator-for-jira?hosting=server&tab=overview] can be used to create projects data automatically.
# Using IE / Edge browser, go to Issues > Search for issues > make sure the Basic search is enabled
# Select "Project: All" dropdown button

h3. Expected Results
The list of projects opens right after clicking the dropdown field.

h3. Actual Results
The list of projects does not open for a long time (or doesn't open at all). After some time, the following warning appears in the browser:
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
The browser becomes unresponsive. Closing and reopening the browser helps with this.

h3. Workaround
* Use Advanced search mode (JQL) and specify the search query
* Use other browser (e.g. Safari, Chrome, Firefox)

h3. Notes
The issue is not reproducible if the instance does not have many projects.
fields.summary: Project dropdown menu in basic issue search does not respond on Internet Explorer / Edge browsers

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When a project is imported, the "Start date" of Versions in the "Releases" page, does not get imported. Only the "Release date" will get imported.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Version in a Software project.
 # Set a "Start date" & a "Release date".
 #* The status of the version does not matter here "UNRELEASED" OR "RELEASED"
 # Create an XML backup
 # Delete the project from Jira
 # Create a new empty project with the same Project key
 # Import the project from the XML back using the "Project Import" tool.
 # Once the import is complete check the version in the "Releases" page of the project.

h3. Expected Results

*Both* the "Start date" & "Release date" should be imported with the project.

h3. Actual Results

*Only* the "Release date" is imported with the project.
The "Start date" isn't getting imported with the project.


*Before the import*

*  !Before.png|thumbnail! 

*After the import*

*  !after.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

You can add the "Start date" manually for each version after the import, but you will have to save/take a screenshot *before* the import in order to have the data in hand.
fields.summary: When a project is imported, the "Start date" of Versions in the "Releases" page, does not get imported

fields.description:
Hi Team,

Customers would like to migrate existing Atlassian applications (Jira & Confluence) from one AWS account to another with pre-configured VPC as per their organizational standards.

Currently the supported Quick Start [Atlassian Standard Infrastructure|https://aws-quickstart.s3.amazonaws.com/quickstart-atlassian-services/doc/atlassian-standard-infrastructure-on-the-aws-cloud.pdf] includes an AWS CloudFormation template that builds out AWS infrastructure components, which are required by all Atlassian Data Center products which is inclusive of VPC.

Hence would like to leverage the ASI cloud formation scripts to work inside their existing VPC provided by their IT teams and are struggling to get them working. So the request is to have ASI cloud formation scripts which allow customers to deploy the ASI inside an existing VPC.

Please help users to meet this requirement.
fields.summary: AWS Cloud formation scripts to deploy Atlassian Standard Infrastructure (ASI) inside an existing VPC

fields.description:
h3. Problem
By default, Jira allows HTML in custom field descriptions and list item values. The configuration item that prevents this is in *Jira Admin -> System -> Enable HTML in custom field descriptions and list item values*, and is is +Enabled+ by default. 

h3. Justification
This introduces scope for values to break the page in exciting ways - for example, adding <!--  break the rest of the page when the field is loaded. Actually, on Field Configuration and Custom Fields pages, this prevents the ability to edit to undo the breakage (aside from editing the database)

Some customers require this, but, we should encourage it's disablement. Disabling it by default would help. 


h3. Suggested Solution
Disable this option by default

from https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftware/jira-software-8-7-x-upgrade-notes-987138245.html
bq. ... It will now be switched to OFF for new Jira installations and the upgraded ones that have never used it.  ... We recommend that you keep this option disabled for security reasons.
fields.summary: Disallow HTML in custom field descriptions and list item values by default

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When there are shared filters created when the user profile is set to "English" if the others are using it whose profile language other than "English" the "JQL" is getting not getting translated when there are decimal numbers present in JQL and the "shared filter" is not working as the decimals in JQL is not getting translated.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a custom field with a name in the "French" language of the "number" type.
 !Screenshot 2020-03-30 at 4.18.46 PM.png|thumbnail!
 # Give the custom field some "Decimal" values.
 # Create a filter with some "JQL" like below, save the filter when the user profile is set to "English" and share it with a group.
 # Log in as a different user whose profile is set to a different language other than "English" and try to access the "shared filter".

h3. Expected Results

The "JQL" saved in the "shared filter" should be translated to the user's profile language and results should be displayed like below:
 !Screenshot 2020-03-31 at 7.03.30 PM.png|thumbnail!
h3. Actual Results

The below error is thrown if we use the same filter when the user profile is set to "French", but the user is expecting it to be working despite the user's profile language.
 !Screenshot 2020-03-31 at 7.07.04 PM.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

As a workaround manually edit the decimal numbers in double-quotes with a comma(,) separator instead of (.) which will give results.

!Screenshot 2020-03-31 at 7.48.30 PM.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Shared filters are not working when the JQL contains decimal numbers and user profile set other than English

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
On many features of Jira, Custom Fields (CF) are referenced by their ID instead of their Name.
On the _Advanced audit log_ page, events related to Custom Fields show only the CF name and not the ID.
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
\\
\\ 
It would be easier to an administrator to have the CF ID also shown in the Audit Log UI

h3. Suggested Solution
In events associated to a Custom Field (created, updated, deleted), include both the Name and the ID of the CF.


h3. Workaround
h4. Prior to Jira Data Center 8.8
The CF ID is stored in the {{audit_log}} database table.
 !screenshot-5.png|thumbnail! 

h4. Jira Data Center 8.8 onward
Although not shown in the UI, the CF ID is stored in the {{AUDIT_ENTITY}} AO table.
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 

\\
\\
From the UI the administrator could inspect the link to the related CF and that would show the ID.
 !screenshot-3.png|thumbnail! 

\\
Exporting the audit log to a CSV file also shows the ID of the related CF.
 !screenshot-4.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: As a Jira Administrator I would like to see the custom field ID in related events of the audit log

fields.summary: As a scrum master, I want to prompt users for additional information when modifying the scope of an in progress sprint

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Attaching a image using the "What you see what you get" panel in the comment section does not update the file name attached. 
Example:
Upload image001.png then check out the text mode in the comment, it points to the correct image which is image001.png, but when uploading another image with the same name image001.png the image uploads correctly with the new name image001-1.png but the comment does not get updated and remains with the original name of the image which is image001.png which is an incorrect behaviour as the comment should be updated to include the new name of the picture which is image001-1.png.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Attach picture attachment in the "What you see what you get" panel in the comment section (Example image001.png)
 # Post the comment 
 # Check the comment in "Text" Mode, it should be 
{code:java}
!image001.png|thumbnail!
{code}
 # Now create a new comment and upload another picture with the same name (image001.png) from the "What you see what you get" panel in the comment section. 
 # The image is uploaded with the name (image001-1.png), which is the correct behaviour as this was fixed in Jira 8.6 and above (https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-2169)
 # Check out the comment in "Text" Mode, it shows {code:java}
!image001.png|thumbnail!
{code} which is incorrect.

h3. Expected Results
When checking out the comment in text mode after uploading the second image, the comment should be {code:java} !image001-1.png|thumbnail! {code} to show the correct picture attached.
h3. Actual Results
When checking out the comment in text mode after uploading the second image, the comment shows {code:java} !image001.png|thumbnail! {code} which is incorrect because it shows the first picture attached not the second picture.

h3. Workaround

Currently, the workaround for this issue is to use the "Drag and Drop" feature to add the image then *choose* the image from the "What you see what you get" panel in the comment section.

OR 

To use the "Browse" feature from the attachment Section in the ticket then *choose* the image from the "What you see what you get" panel in the comment section.

(+) You could also manually edit the image name from the comment in text mode.

Note that you can find both those features from the section shown in the picture below:

*  !Attachment.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Attaching an image using the "What you see what you get" panel in the comment section does not update the file name correctly in the comment

fields.description:
h3. Summary:

When a user is deleted from an external directory (LDAP or external Crowd server), references to this user will retain in the {{projectroleactor}} table.
h3. Steps to Reproduce:
 # Configure an external directory in Jira via the page *⚙ > User Management > User Directories* (with an LDAP or Crowd server)
 # Add a user to the LDAP (or Crowd) server (username: chibi6)
 # Sync Jira with the LDAP (or Crowd) server
 # Add that user to a Project Role in any Jira project
 # Delete the user from the LDAP (or Crowd) server
 # Sync again Jira with the LDAP (or Crowd) server
 # Go to the *⚙ > User Management > Users* page, and verify that the user is no longer there
 # Go to the Project Role page and verify that the user is not displayed there:
!Screenshot1.png|thumbnail!
 # Run the following SQL query and verify that the user has been deleted from the {{cwd_user}} table
{code:java}
select id, directory_id, user_name, active from cwd_user where user_name = 'chibi6';
{code}
!Screenshot2.png|thumbnail!
 # Run the following SQL query:
{code:java}
select * from projectroleactor where roletypeparameter = 'chibi6';
{code}

h3. Expected Results:

The user is deleted from the {{projectroleactor}} table.
h3. Actual Results:

The user is not deleted from this table, even though the user is not showing in the Project Role in the UI, causing some data discrepancy in the database:
!Screenshot3.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

The only workaround to avoid this discrepancy is to manually delete the rows from the {{projectroleactor}} table for the user(s) that have been deleted from the LDAP (or Crowd) server.

(!) If you decide to go ahead with this workaround, make sure to create a native backup of your Jira Database, so that you can revert the changes if anything goes wrong.
h3. Notes

*Note 1*
 This bug does not occur when a user is deleted from the Jira Internal Directory. In this case, when the user is deleted from this directory via the page *⚙ > User Management > Users* (or from the Jira API via the end point {{api/2/user}}), the user is properly deleted from the {{projectroleactor}} table.

*Note 2*

This bug was reproduced in Jira versions 8.4.2 and 8.7.1, but it is likely that this bug has been there for a while in older versions (such as 7.x)
fields.summary: Deleting a user from LDAP or Crowd server will not delete this user from the projectroleactor table

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When performing basic search using custom field used in multiple projects, no values shows for selection. It shows "No Matches" in the drop down.

!Screenshot 2020-03-30 at 2.14.55 PM.png|width=548,height=205!

In that case, I was able to perform an advanced search and select the value, but when switching back to basic search, the value was not supported.

!Screenshot 2020-03-30 at 2.13.05 PM.png|width=640,height=171!

!Screenshot 2020-03-30 at 2.03.27 PM.png|width=636,height=157!
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * Create a custom field, use it in different context.
 * Try to perform a basic search, using it as criteria along with the correct issue type.

h3. Expected Results

You should be able to to select that field's options.
h3. Actual Results

You cannot perform a basic search using the custom field even though the criteria matches with its scope.
h3. Workaround

Use [advanced search|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwareserver/advanced-searching-939938733.html] instead.
fields.summary: Cannot perform basic search towards a field with even though the search criteria matches its scope

fields.description:
*Problem Description*:
 Customers are planning to move from using [Jira Server for Slack|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1220099/jira-server-for-slack-official?hosting=server&tab=overview] plugin which was developed by Atlassian to Microsoft Teams.

*Suggestion*:
 Currently, there is no plugin developed by Atlassian to integrate with Microsoft Teams. Customers who were using Jira Server for Slack are hesitant to use a plugin developed by the third-party vendor as it is charged. It would be useful to have a plugin developed by Atlassian to Integrate Jira Server with Microsoft Teams (similar to Jira Server for Slack).
fields.summary: Integration of Jira with Microsoft Teams application

fields.description:
In current implementation of the Atlassian Scheduler, the purge of old RunDetails is performed after each new execution of a Job.

It responds to most of usage case, when a job is concerned by a schedule.

But others usage cases may require the ability to purge RunDetails given to users or plugins :
 * Case of RunDetails created by old versions of plugin or uninstalled plugins
 * Case of RunDetails created by many occurrence Jobs in a plugin (My current case)

 I am currently preparing a plugin where many instance of Jobs can be created, where I use a JobId based on a <FeatureKey>:<FeatureId>. I use the Job in order to benefit from the Asynchronous mode in most of case, and also (in more rare case) from Scheduler.

Currently a purge method - _*purgeHistory(Date before)*_ - is defined in OfBizRunDetailsDao, but it is not accessible.

Thanks 

V.
fields.summary: Ability to purge RunDetails of Scheduler

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When reading in multi-line text field data from the database to display when viewing an issue, Jira serializes "\r" carriage returns into each line, artificially inflating the character count. If the field content is close to or meets the character limit, you will be unable to make any edits to the issue in the UI; the validator will throw an error indicating that the text entered for that custom field is too long.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new multi-line text custom field and add it field scheme of test project
 # Create a new test issue
 # Import the attached repro1.txt file via REST. You can copy and paste the Curl command from attached curl1.txt, substitute username, custom field ID, and issue key as needed.
 # View the newly-created record in the *customfieldvalue* table and check the character count:
{code:sql}
select textvalue from customfieldvalue where id  = (select max(id) from customfieldvalue);

select length(textvalue) from customfieldvalue where id  = (select max(id) from customfieldvalue);
{code}

 # Attempt to edit the issue in the UI, note the validation error indicating the field data is too long.
 # Create another test issue
 # Import the attached repro2.txt file via REST. You can copy and paste the Curl command from attached curl2.txt, substitute username, custom field ID, and issue key as needed. This is a much smaller file to demonstrate the injection of the carriage returns to the data.
 # Check the record and character count:
{code:sql}
select textvalue from customfieldvalue where id  = (select max(id) from customfieldvalue);

select length(textvalue) from customfieldvalue where id  = (select max(id) from customfieldvalue);
{code}

 # Navigate to the issue in the UI and edit the text in the the custom field to append a final "." character.
 # Check the record and character count again

h3. Expected Results

In the first test, Jira should allow you to save changes to the issue as the custom field data is at the limit.

In the second test, the character count of the field should only increment by 1.
h3. Actual Results

In the first test, Jira serializes the "\r" characters into the field data, causing it to exceed the character count.

In the second test, you can see this character injection when reviewing the data in the customfield. The character count has grown more than the expected single character and you can now see the "\r" characters injected into the data.
h3. Workaround

There has been no workaround identified at this time.
fields.summary: Jira serializes "\r" return characters into multi-line text custom fields, inflating the character count

fields.description:
h3. Problem definition
Currently, {{membersOf()}} works only with User picker fields, which means the function checks if a certain user is a member of the group. However, the function cannot check if a certain group belongs to a parent group (it doesn't work with Group picker field types).

h3. Suggested resolution
Extend the function (or add a new one) so that the function can check whether a group is a member of a parent group.
fields.summary: Extend membersOf JQL function to work with Group picker fields

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

users are shown as logged in (*into Jira*) if they are *watching a confluence space* and a new confluence page with the Jira Issue/Filter macro or the Jira Charts macro is added.

Everytime a linked application pulls data from JIRA for a user, it will use an OAuth connection towards JIRA to verify if the user has the correct permissions and credentials to view the specified data. This could be a macro within Confluence, but also a linked JIRA issue.

When showing any content to a user, Jira checks the permission of the user viewing the page as otherwise, it could end up in a security issue.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # make sure that Jira and Confluence share the same *userbase*
 # create an *Oauth application link* between Jira and Confluence.
 # create a *space* in Confluence
 # add some users as *watchers* of the newly created space
 # with a different user, create a new page under the newly created space and either insert in the page the *Jira Issue/Filters macro* or the *Jira Charts macro*.
 # observe into *Jira access logs* into the Jira Web UI user management that the users watching the space in Confluence are shown as logged in Jira even if they didn't logged in Jira.

This behaviour has been tested with *Jira 7.9.2* and *Confluence 6.14.3*.
h3. Expected Results
Users should not login into Jira.

h3. Actual Results
Users *watching the space* are marked as logged in Jira.

h3. Workaround

The only workaround that I found consist into removing the *Confluence application access group* to the users which we don't want to see as logged in Jira.
fields.summary: Users are shown as logged in if they are watching a confluence space and a new confluence page with the Jira macro or the Jira Charts macro is added

fields.description:
h3. Summary

This is a more specific version of JRASERVER-62772 covering scenario when localhost-startStop-1 and {{localq-reader}} threads are deadlocking during DC node startup

Any simultaneous calls to {{<T> T getComponent(final Class<T> componentType)}} and to {{<T> List<T> getComponents(final Class<T> componentType)}} in {{DefaultPicoContainer}} from parallel threads can lead to deadlock.

h3. Also it happens on JIRA's startup:

The following error can be found in the logs :
{noformat}
2020-01-08 09:28:37,841 DeadlockDetection:thread-1 ERROR [c.a.jira.startup.LauncherContextListener] A deadlock has been detected on JIRA startup for the following threads: ["localq-reader-0" Id=31 BLOCKED on org.picocontainer.DefaultPicoContainer@1b84f9c1 owned by "localhost-startStop-1" Id=16, "localhost-startStop-1" Id=16 WAITING on java.util.concurrent.locks.ReentrantLock$NonfairSync@154314c1 owned by "localq-reader-0" Id=31]
2020-01-08 09:28:37,843 DeadlockDetection:thread-1 ERROR [c.a.jira.startup.LauncherContextListener] "localq-reader-0" Id=31 BLOCKED on org.picocontainer.DefaultPicoContainer@1b84f9c1 owned by "localhost-startStop-1" Id=16
2020-01-08 09:28:37,843 DeadlockDetection:thread-1 ERROR [c.a.jira.startup.LauncherContextListener] "localhost-startStop-1" Id=16 WAITING on java.util.concurrent.locks.ReentrantLock$NonfairSync@154314c1 owned by "localq-reader-0" Id=31
{noformat}


h3. Workaround
* Delete the [JIRA-HOME]/localq/* directory contents
* restart Jira
fields.summary: JIRA deadlocks in PicoСontainer while start-up and replaying events by localq-reader

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When selecting an option through any sort of dropdown menu (combo boxes, date pickers), the option that is chosen by the user is not read out by a voice assistant utility if enabled.

*This prevents (or at least makes it very hard) creating issues by visually impaired people*, as they can't reliably change issue types, projects, priorities, etc.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Enable Voice Over (or any other assistive technologies that provide announcements).
 # Click *Create* to create a new issue.
 # Tab to the *Projects* or *Issue Types* drop-down menu.
 # Select an option using the UP and DOWN arrows, then click enter to confirm the choice.

h3. Expected Results
The option chosen will be read by the VA utility, confirming the choice to the user.

h3. Actual Results
No feedback is given to the user through the VA utility.

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Voice over assistants do not read out options picked in drop down menus

None.

fields.description:
The article [Jira application cookies|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/jira-application-cookies-938847892.html] states that the parameter _autologin.cookie.age_ can use the value *2592000*. When using this value, Jira will behave erratically. The maximum value that this parameter can use is *2147483*, as stated in the bug [JRASERVER-25985|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-25985].

Is it possible to modify the article to state the correct value for the parameter _autologin.cookie.age_? Adding the bug in the article could also be helpful for the customers.
fields.summary: Documentation contains a wrong value that can cause a NullPointerException

fields.description:
Depending on outside factors the LDAP server might fail to respond to respond to new connection requests.  This only happens to new connection requests.

However, Jira is opening a new connection for every single group that is to be synced. IF the LDAP directory has many groups this can turn into an issue:
If one of these connections run into the timeout, then the entire sync is halted somewhere in the middle. This is quite bad in grand scheme of things, as sometimes 1% of the groups are skipped, sometimes 99% and other times somewhere inbetween.

There are two scenarios that could be thought of to avoid this:
 * be able to configure a "Retry count", if a connection times out, then rety X number of times.
 * be able to configure the import to reuse the same connection for all group lookups. That way it is more of a "all or nothing" success. This should default to off to retain todays behaviour as some environment will depend on it, but for environments where the entire "truth" is found in one directory this would be a massive performance gain.
fields.summary: improve reaction to LDAP synchronisation connection timeouts

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

User Picker custom field returns No Matches for the users. This happens when the user picker has the project context, not a global context. It's happened because the REST request does not contain *projectId.*

h3. Environment
* The user picker Custom Fields has the project context

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create the project - *P1,*
 # Create two users with similar user name - *cos*, *cos2,*
 # Create the User Picker custom field - *daj* - with *P1* project context,
 # Open a simple search,
 # Choose the project *P1,*
 # Add *daj* custom field,
 # Open *daj* user picker dialog and search for the user *cos*  and pick him,
 # Close *daj* user picker dialog for instance by clicking somewhere else on the page,
 # Open *daj* user picker dialog one more time and search for the user *cos2.*

h3. Expected Results
{code:java}
http://localhost:8080/rest/api/latest/groupuserpicker?projectId=10000&fieldId=customfield_10200&showAvatar=true&query=cos&_=1584541558570{code}
!image-2020-03-18-15-40-00-902.png!
h3. Actual Results
{code:java}
http://localhost:8080/rest/api/latest/groupuserpicker?fieldId=customfield_10200&showAvatar=true&query=cos&_=1584541558577{code}
!image-2020-03-18-15-39-07-477.png!
h3. Workaround

Change custom field context to global
fields.summary: User Picker does not return any new user if any other users have been picked

fields.description:
Sometimes we have the problem that people from the team have vacation on the sprint planning day. They then come back to the office and add more user stories to the sprint.

Of course this will change the sprint scope (on purpose) - but the Burndown Chart optimal burn down line does not show this for the rest of the sprint as it sticks to the initial commited tasks.

Is there a way that the grey line can react on the sprint change? Otherwise the burndown chart is completely useless whenever one team member returns from his/her vacation.
fields.summary: Update Burndown Chart grey optimal line based on scope change

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently and for a long while, we've included information messages in the user interface to let the client know their recent changes require a reindex. These messages are not helpful where the client has automated API requests to trigger a reindex as the API isn't letting them know if the reindex is required or not to start with.

h3. Suggested Solution
The client would love either the index summary endpoint to be extended (i.e. api/2/index/summary) or a new one created like a GETtable /rest/api/2/reindex/required that provided a "true" or "false" value to highlight whether a reindex is recommended.

h3. Workaround
No workaround here at present
fields.summary: As a Jira DC/Server administrator, I would like an API endpoint to tell me if the instance needs a lucene reindex
Zooming an issue using Safari app on iPhone causes issue view to have less visible area
